channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 100 多万巴勒斯坦人逃到加沙最南端的拉法，希望逃离战争。现在，以色列威胁要扩大对那里的入侵，这些家庭担心他们会被困在那里。
item.description:
Más de un millón de palestinos huyeron a Rafah, la región más al sur de Gaza, con la esperanza de escapar de la guerra. Ahora, Israel ha amenazado con ampliar su invasión allí y las familias temen estar atrapadas. https://t.co/ss11wGU6Su

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 本周足球通讯：寻找足球界的下一波教练；令人惊讶的欧洲冠军联赛决胜局（实际上是两场）以及我们可以从中解读出的东西；一位主席对 "幸运 "红色球衣的坦白。通过 @罗里-史密斯：
item.description:
In this week’s soccer newsletter: a search for soccer’s next wave of coaches; a surprising Champions League shootout (two, actually) and what we can read into it; and a chairman comes clean on “lucky” red jerseys. Via @RorySmith: https://t.co/jkJj3aZ9Du

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰当局说，两枚导弹相隔一段时间击中同一地点，造成前来应对第一次袭击的救援人员伤亡。
item.description:
Two missiles hit the same spot some time apart, Ukrainian authorities said, making casualties among rescuers who had come to respond to the first attack. https://t.co/MPUZfjO3gI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 据索马里官员称，恐怖组织 Al Shabab 的五名袭击者于周四晚间袭击了索马里总统府附近高度设防地区的一家酒店，与安全部队持续交战约 12 个小时。
item.description:
Five assailants with the terrorist group Al Shabab stormed a hotel in a highly fortified area close to Somalia’s presidential palace on Thursday night, engaging security forces for about 12 hours in sustained fighting, according to Somali officials. https://t.co/IePGkuc9gL

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 他以为自己从英国河里捞起了一根竹竿或一些废料。结果发现，这块又细又长的金属片是一把生锈的维京剑，很可能已经存在了 1000 多年。
item.description:
He thought he had pulled a pole, or some scrap from an English river. It turned out the long, thin piece of metal was a rusty Viking sword which had likely been there for more than 1,000 years. https://t.co/4MQB8Ut255

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 肯特-坎贝尔（Kent Campbell）是全球抗击疟疾的重要人物，尤其是在非洲，他领导了一项提供蚊帐的创新计划，保护农村村民免受携带疟疾的蚊子的侵害。
item.description:
Kent Campbell, an instrumental figure in the global battle against malaria — most notably in Africa, where he led an innovative program providing bed nets to protect rural villagers from the mosquitoes that carry the disease — has died at 80. https://t.co/xhRsugZq5p

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 该委员会将于下周在日内瓦向人权理事会提交一份报告，详细叙述在俄罗斯和被占领的乌克兰发生的酷刑事件，并强化之前的调查结果。
item.description:
The commission will deliver a report to the Human Rights Council in Geneva next week detailing accounts of torture in Russia and occupied Ukraine, strengthening previous findings. https://t.co/AlDQ2LYsx8

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 周四晚，塞内加尔两名反对党政治家获释，此时距离全国大选仅有 10 天时间，其中一人将参加总统竞选。
item.description:
Two opposition party politicians were released from jail in Senegal on Thursday night, just 10 days before a nationwide election in which one of them is running for president. https://t.co/Z0i2M2NtaI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 此次选举正值俄罗斯人在战场上取得胜利，而美国对乌克兰的支持却在减弱。普京先生近来一直以自信的口吻向俄罗斯人保证，生活将再次恢复正常。
item.description:
The election comes as Russians are winning on the battlefield amid waning support for Ukraine in the United States. Mr. Putin has of late adopted a tone of confidence, reassuring Russians that life will once again be normal. https://t.co/66i8PPzYRc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 在过去的一周里，日本福山市一直处于警戒状态，因为一只潜在的危险猫显然掉进了一家工厂的有毒化学品罐中，然后逃进了城市。
item.description:
Durante la última semana, la ciudad japonesa de Fukuyama ha estado en alerta por un gato potencialmente peligroso que aparentemente cayó en un tanque de productos químicos tóxicos en una fábrica y luego escapó a la ciudad. https://t.co/jTVUQyIEOp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 在俄罗斯全面入侵乌克兰两年之后，联合国调查人员称他们发现了新的证据，证明俄罗斯安全部队对乌克兰囚犯实施了系统而广泛的酷刑。
item.description:
Two years after Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, United Nations investigators say they have uncovered new evidence of systematic and widespread torture of Ukrainian prisoners held by Russian security forces. https://t.co/Lfk68n0uaQ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 法国和德国领导人将努力弥合两国在战争问题上日益公开的分歧，并与波兰总理就支持基辅问题举行会谈。
item.description:
The leaders of France and Germany will try to heal an increasingly public rift over their approach to the war, and hold talks alongside Poland’s prime minister on support for Kyiv. https://t.co/sNXx4zQmbN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 面对本周末的选举，以及阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼（Aleksei Navalny）之死和乌克兰战争的影响，俄罗斯利用中国首创的技术加强了网络审查。
item.description:
Facing an election this weekend and the fallout from Aleksei Navalny’s death and the war in Ukraine, Russia has intensified online censorship using techniques pioneered by China. https://t.co/ifmNg3i4b1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 查克-苏西（Chuck Searcy）数十年如一日，致力于解决美国越战遗留下来的一个致命问题：未爆弹药。
item.description:
Chuck Searcy has spent decades of his life redressing a deadly legacy of America’s war in Vietnam: unexploded ordnance. https://t.co/rQCbNBkKcS

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 在过去的一周里，日本福山市一直在警惕一只潜在的危险猫，这只猫似乎掉进了一家工厂的有毒化学品罐中，然后逃到了整个城市。
item.description:
For the past week, the Japanese city of Fukuyama has been on watch for a potentially hazardous cat that appears to have fallen into a tank of toxic chemicals at a factory and then escaped into the city at large. https://t.co/dXgoOOhDqg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 加沙的电信基础设施遭到严重破坏，人们很难打电话求助或协调援助物资的运送。"一名紧急医疗工作者说："在战争期间，生与死的差别可能就在一个电话之间。
item.description:
The heavily damaged telecommunications infrastructure in Gaza has made it difficult for people to call for help or coordinate aid deliveries.

“During a war, the difference between life and death can be one phone call,” an emergency medical worker said. https://t.co/g4az3RtkQL

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 15, 2024

item.title: 由于极端天气条件导致火灾数量创下历史新高，亚马逊地区各国都在奋力扑救，数百平方公里的亚马逊雨林被烧毁。
item.description:
Cientos de kilómetros cuadrados de la selva amazónica han ardido mientras los países de la región luchan contra un número récord de incendios impulsados por condiciones meteorológicas extremas. https://t.co/zZzRtam4MX

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 以色列对哈马斯的轰炸摧毁了加沙的电信基础设施，这在很大程度上阻碍了巴勒斯坦人呼救、协调援助物资运送以及与国外家人联系。
item.description:
Israel’s bombing campaign against Hamas has pummeled the telecommunications infrastructure in Gaza, largely preventing Palestinians from calling for help, coordinating the delivery of aid and communicating with family abroad. https://t.co/O4epa6HYdZ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 纽约时报》请加沙的三个家庭分享他们过去几周寻找食物的照片和视频。他们都说，食物越来越难找，大多数时候，他们都不知道自己还能不能吃上饭。
item.description:
The New York Times asked three families in Gaza to share photos and videos of their search for food over the past few weeks. They all said that food was getting harder to find, and that most days, they did not know whether they would eat at all. https://t.co/XdxqJHr1bo

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 谁把蛇放出来的？气候变化。由于爬行动物的冬眠期--冬眠期正在缩短，蛇与人类的遭遇正在增加。
item.description:
Who let the snakes out? Climate change. Encounters between snakes and humans are increasing, as the period of brumation, a sort of hibernation for reptiles, is shrinking. https://t.co/eaJwgyVoPw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 意大利外交官詹多梅尼科-皮科（Giandomenico Picco）去世，享年 75 岁。
item.description:
Giandomenico Picco, an Italian diplomat who as the “chief troubleshooter” for the United Nations helped resolve conflicts across the globe, has died at 75. https://t.co/ZPym5y4vqE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: "只有联盟中的所有政党都支持我，我才能成为首相。事实并非如此，"耶尔特-威尔德斯在社交媒体上写道。他补充说，他希望有一个右翼内阁，并减少移民。
item.description:
“I can only become prime minister if ALL parties in the coalition support it. That wasn’t the case,” Geert Wilders wrote on social media. He added that he wanted a right-wing cabinet and less immigration. https://t.co/nFnrfQEC8d

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰的无人机袭击能够击中俄罗斯领土深处的炼油厂，这表明了一个新的薄弱环节。但目前还不清楚这是否会影响战斗。
item.description:
Ukrainian drone strikes have been able to hit refineries deep in Russian territory, indicating a new vulnerability. But it is unclear if that will impact the fighting. https://t.co/n0KFrLrMTh

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 一个欧洲人道主义援助组织周四称，约有 50 名移民在试图横渡地中海中部时因小船瘪了而死亡。
item.description:
A European humanitarian aid group said on Thursday that about 50 migrants died after their small boat deflated during an attempt to cross the central Mediterranean Sea. https://t.co/kMR1ky5EAF

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 一位美国外交官说，维克托-欧尔班反对帮助乌克兰并与俄罗斯保持友好关系，这使匈牙利在北约的地位岌岌可危，不过他并没有要求将匈牙利从北约中除名。
item.description:
Viktor Orban’s opposition to helping Ukraine and friendly relations with Russia put Hungary’s status in NATO in jeopardy, a U.S. diplomat said, though he stopped well short of calling for Hungary’s removal from the alliance. https://t.co/8JsLjUcJvA

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 100 多万巴勒斯坦人逃到加沙最南端的拉法，希望躲避战火。现在，以色列威胁要扩大对那里的入侵，这些家庭担心他们会被困在那里。
item.description:
More than one million Palestinians fled into Rafah, the southernmost region of Gaza, hoping to escape the war. Now, Israel has threatened to extend its invasion there and families fear they are trapped. https://t.co/x9SKJL9vu9

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 最终可能强制要求出售 TikTok 的立法正在向前推进。但是，其中国母公司字节跳动的任何形式的资产剥离都很可能具有挑战性。
item.description:
Legislation that could eventually mandate a sale of TikTok is moving forward. But any kind of divestiture by its Chinese parent company, ByteDance, is likely to prove challenging. https://t.co/IaYMVL61Pc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 斯洛伐克总统职位主要是一个礼仪性职位，但当总统和总理代表对立的政治阵营时，总统职位就会发挥重要作用。
item.description:
The Slovak presidency is a largely ceremonial post but can play an important role when the president and prime minister represent opposing political camps.

Here’s what to know about Slovakia’s presidential election. https://t.co/cHvVNRWdhx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 英国政府公布了极端主义的新定义，并表示打算以此切断与被认为越界的团体的联系或资助。批评人士担心，这可能会限制运动人士的权利，遏制言论自由。
item.description:
Britain’s government published a new definition of extremism that it says it intends to use to cut ties or funding to groups deemed to have crossed the line. Critics fear it could curtail campaigners’ rights and curb free speech. https://t.co/lZoZp5MftI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 即使在匪帮恐吓海地、绑架平民、肆意杀戮的时候，海地总理仍在坚守岗位。然后，几天之内，一切都变了。在政治动荡中，海地总理阿里尔-亨利同意下台。
item.description:
Even as gangs terrorized Haiti, kidnapped civilians and killed at will, the country’s prime minister held on to power. Then, in a matter of days, everything changed. Amid political upheaval, Haiti’s prime minister, Ariel Henry, agreed to step down. https://t.co/Cd2o00tzoW

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024
